title: How To Create a Two Column Layout

metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: Learn how to create a 2-column layout grid with CSS.
content.html: Learn how to create a 2-column layout grid with CSS.

content.text: How To Create a Two Column Layout

content.code_html:
<div class="row">
  <div class="column"></div>
  <div class="column"></div>
</div>

content.text: In this example, we will create two equal columns:
content.html: In this example, we will create two equal columns:

content.code_html:
.column {
  float: left;
  width: 50%;
}

/* Clear floats after the columns */
.row:after {
  content: "";
  display: table;
  clear: both;
}

content.text: A modern way of creating two columns, is to use CSS Flexbox . However, it is not supported in Internet Explorer 10 and earlier versions.
content.html: A modern way of creating two columns, is to use CSS Flexbox. However, it is not supported in Internet Explorer 10 and earlier versions.

content.code_html:
.row {
  display: flex;
}

.column {
  flex: 50%;
}

content.text: It is up to you if you want to use floats or flex to create a two-column layout. However, if you need support for IE10 and down, you should use float.
content.html: It is up to you if you want to use floats or flex to create a two-column layout. However, if you need support for IE10 and down, you should use float.

content.text: Tip: To learn more about the Flexible Box Layout Module, read our CSS Flexbox chapter .
content.html: Tip: To learn more about the Flexible Box Layout Module, read our CSS Flexbox chapter.

content.text: In this example, we will create two unequal columns:
content.html: In this example, we will create two unequal columns:

content.code_html:
.column {
  float: left;
}

.left {
  width: 25%;
}

.right {
  width: 75%;
}

content.text: In this example, we will create a responsive two column layout:
content.html: In this example, we will create a responsive two column layout:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
/* Responsive layout - when the screen is less than 600px wide, make the two 
  columns stack on top of each other instead of next to each other */

syntax_highlighting.text:
/* Responsive layout - when the screen is less than 600px wide, make the two 
  columns stack on top of each other instead of next to each other */

content.code_html:
/* Responsive layout - when the screen is less than 600px wide, make the two columns stack on top of each other instead of next to each other */
@media screen and (max-width: 600px) {
  .column {
    width: 100%;
  }
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
/* Responsive layout - when the screen is less than 600px wide, make the two 
  columns stack on top of each other instead of next to each other */

content.text: Tip: Go to our CSS Website Layout Tutorial to learn more about website layouts.
content.html: Tip: Go to our CSS Website Layout Tutorial to learn more about website layouts.

content.text: Tip: Go to our CSS Responsive Web Design Tutorial to learn more about responsive web design and grids.
content.html: Tip: Go to our CSS Responsive Web Design Tutorial to learn more about responsive web design and grids.
